name: fileanalysis-default_config.xml-format
description: The file 'etc/default_config.xml' is in binary or non-text format, making it impossible to directly extract software component names and version numbers. It is necessary to examine other files or employ alternative methods to obtain the SBOM required information.
notes: Check other configuration files or executable files for software component and version information. Binary analysis tools or reverse engineering methods may be required for further analysis of this file.

name: component-vsftpd-version-unknown
description: The file 'etc/vsftpd.conf' contains a TP-LINK customized FTP server configuration, but no explicit version information is included. The 'ftpd_banner' configuration item in the file displays 'Welcome to TP-LINK FTP server'. Multiple CVE vulnerabilities related to vsftpd were identified through searching the NVD database, but due to the lack of specific version information, it cannot be confirmed whether these vulnerabilities apply to the current system.
notes:
It is recommended to further inspect other parts of the system (such as binary files or log files related to the FTP service) to obtain more accurate version information. The discovered relevant CVEs:
- CVE-2017-8218: vsftpd on TP-Link C2 and C20i devices through firmware 0.9.1 4.2 v0032.0 Build 160706 Rel.37961n has a backdoor REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER account (CVSS: 9.8)
- CVE-2011-2523: vsftpd 2.3.4 contains a backdoor which opens a shell on port 6200/tcp (CVSS: 9.8)
- CVE-2021-30047: VSFTPD 3.0.3 allows DoS due to limited connections (CVSS: 7.5)

name: thirdparty-component-telnetd-cos
description: Two third-party components, telnetd and cos, were identified in the rcS startup script, but their version information could not be determined. Further analysis of the relevant binary files is required to obtain accurate version details.
notes:
The following files are required to proceed with the analysis:  
1. /usr/sbin/telnetd  
2. /usr/sbin/cos  
3. /etc/services  
4. /proc/version  

It is recommended that the user provide these files to obtain accurate version information and associated CVE vulnerabilities.

name: SBOM-jQuery-1.8.3
description: The jQuery component version 1.8.3 was found in the 'web/index.htm' file. Evidence source: filename: jquery-1.8.3.min.js. No direct CVE vulnerabilities have been identified for jQuery 1.8.3 at this time. It is recommended to monitor for potential vulnerabilities in jQuery 1.8.3.
notes: It is recommended to monitor potential vulnerabilities in jQuery 1.8.3.

name: thirdparty-jQuery-1.8.3
description: The file 'web/js/jquery-1.8.3.min.js' contains the jQuery component and its version information, along with identified high-risk vulnerabilities. It is recommended to upgrade to jQuery 3.5.0 or later to address these vulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities can only be exploited if an attacker gains control over the HTML content passed to jQuery DOM manipulation methods.
notes: Version evidence: web/js/jquery-1.8.3.min.js Line 1. High-risk vulnerabilities: CVE-2020-11022 (CVSS 6.9), CVE-2020-11023 (CVSS 6.9). Recommended to upgrade to jQuery 3.5.0 or later.

name: component-version-perfect-scrollbar-missing

It is recommended to obtain the version information of this file through other means (such as project documentation, package manager information, etc.).

description: The file 'web/js/err.js' contains only internal error handling code and messages, with no third-party software components or version information found.

name: no-3rdparty-lib-version-libjs
description: No third-party library names or version information were found in the file 'web/js/lib.js'. The 'version' keyword mentioned in the file is solely used for browser version detection. Further examination of other files or directories is required to obtain complete third-party library information.
